SEARCH
Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Interface ISurface

All Superinterfaces:
RefCounted
All Known Subinterfaces:
IGpuSurface
All Known Implementing Classes:
GLRenderTarget, GLRenderTexture, GLTexture, GpuRenderTarget, GpuTexture, RenderTargetProxy, RenderTextureProxy, SurfaceProxy, TextureProxy, VulkanTexture
public interface ISurface extends RefCounted
Defines Surface-hierarchy constants. Do NOT directly this class as type.

  • Field Details

    • FLAG_NONE

      static final int FLAG_NONE
      Surface flags shared between the Surface invalid input: '&' SurfaceProxy class hierarchies. An arbitrary combination of flags may result in unexpected behaviors.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_BUDGETED

      static final int FLAG_BUDGETED
      Indicates whether an allocation should count against a cache budget. Budgeted when set, otherwise not budgeted.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_APPROX_FIT

      static final int FLAG_APPROX_FIT
      Indicates whether a backing store needs to be an exact match or can be larger than is strictly necessary. Approx fit when set, otherwise exact fit.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_MIPMAPPED

      static final int FLAG_MIPMAPPED
      Used to say whether a texture has mip levels allocated or not. Mipmaps are allocated when set, otherwise mipmaps are not allocated.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_RENDERABLE

      static final int FLAG_RENDERABLE
      Used to say whether a surface can be rendered to, whether a texture can be used as color attachments. Renderable when set, otherwise not renderable.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_PROTECTED

      static final int FLAG_PROTECTED
      Used to say whether texture is backed by protected memory. Protected when set, otherwise not protected.
      See Also:
      • Protected Memory
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_READ_ONLY

      @Internal static final int FLAG_READ_ONLY
      Means the pixels in the texture are read-only. GpuTexture and TextureProxy only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_SKIP_ALLOCATOR

      @Internal static final int FLAG_SKIP_ALLOCATOR
      When set, the proxy will be instantiated outside the allocator (e.g. for proxies that are instantiated in on-flush callbacks). Otherwise, SurfaceAllocator should instantiate the proxy. SurfaceProxy only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_DEFERRED_PROVIDER

      @Internal static final int FLAG_DEFERRED_PROVIDER
      For TextureProxies created in a deferred list recording thread it is possible for the unique key to be cleared on the backing GpuTexture while the unique key remains on the proxy. When set, it loosens up asserts that the key of an instantiated uniquely-keyed texture proxy is also always set on the backing GpuTexture. TextureProxy only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_GL_WRAP_DEFAULT_FB

      @Internal static final int FLAG_GL_WRAP_DEFAULT_FB
      This is a OpenGL only flag. It tells us that the internal render target wraps the OpenGL default framebuffer (id=0) that preserved by window. RT only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_MANUAL_MSAA_RESOLVE

      @Internal static final int FLAG_MANUAL_MSAA_RESOLVE
      This means the render target is multi-sampled, and internally holds a non-msaa texture for resolving into. The render target resolves itself by blit-ting into this internal texture. (It might or might not have the internal texture access, but if it does, we always resolve the render target before accessing this texture's data.) RT only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FLAG_VK_WRAP_SECONDARY_CB

      @Internal static final int FLAG_VK_WRAP_SECONDARY_CB
      This is a Vulkan only flag. It tells us that the internal render target is wrapping a raw Vulkan secondary command buffer. RT only.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getApproxSize

      static int getApproxSize(int size)
      Map size to a larger multiple of 2. Values invalid input: '<'= 1024 will pop up to the next power of 2. Those above 1024 will only go up half the floor power of 2.

      Possible values: 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 1536, 2048, 3072, 4096, 6144, 8192, 12288, 16384

      See Also:
      • FLAG_APPROX_FIT

    • ref

      void ref()
      Increases the reference count by 1 on the client pipeline.
      Specified by:
      ref in interface RefCounted

    • unref

      void unref()
      Decreases the reference count by 1 on the client pipeline.
      Specified by:
      unref in interface RefCounted

    • getWidth

      int getWidth()
      Returns:
      the width of the surface in pixels, greater than zero

    • getHeight

      int getHeight()
      Returns:
      the height of the surface in pixels, greater than zero

    • getBackendFormat

      @Nonnull BackendFormat getBackendFormat()
      Returns:
      the backend format of the surface

    • getSampleCount

      default int getSampleCount()
      Returns the number of samples per pixel in color buffers (one if non-MSAA).
      Returns:
      the number of samples, greater than (multi-sampled) or equal to one
